title: PowerShell Core Architecture and Development Overview
body:
PowerShell 7+ is built on .NET Core/.NET 5+ and uses a sophisticated architecture. Key components:

**Build System:**
- Uses dotnet CLI as primary build tool
- ResGen and TypeCatalogGen for resource generation
- crossgen2 for ahead-of-time optimization
- Dummy dependencies structure for flexible builds

**Module System:**
- Version-specific subdirectories (e.g., 7.4.0/)
- Automatic module discovery and loading
- PSModulePath environment variable for module locations
- Module manifests (.psd1) define metadata

**Native Components:**
- libpsl-native (cross-platform native library)
- PSRP.Windows (Windows PowerShell Remoting Protocol)
- Platform-specific assemblies for OS integration

**Cross-Platform Support:**
- .NET Standard 2.0 compatibility
- Preprocessor macros: DEBUG, UNIX, CORECLR
- Runtime checks for OS-specific features
- Single binary for all Unix variants

**Package Distribution:**
- NuGet packages for modules and dependencies
- MSI/DEB/RPM for platform installers
- Portable builds for xcopy deployment
audience: PowerShell developers, contributors, and advanced users
requirement: Must understand PowerShell Core architecture for effective development
